result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrell J Bostwick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.  Absolute sobriety is required.  Continue program currently involved in.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Seized money to be returned.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.  Firearm prohibition warning given.

records.addlTxt: Releasing firearm & money seized in search warrant
From Attorney Frank R Lettenberger- forwarded to Judge Jude for review

Defendant Darrell J Bostwick in court with attorney Francis R. Lettenberger.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Plea questionnaire filed.
State's offer:  plea to count 1 without within 1000' of prohibited place.  Balance of counts to be dismissed and read-in. Recommend probation and 6 mos RCJ
Court colloquy re elements of crime and possible penalties.
PLEA - guilty
Finding of guilt
Court finds plea entered freely and voluntarily
PSI waived by parties, case to proceed to sentencing
State's sentencing argument includes seizure of the money confiscated from home.  Firearms may be returned to owner.
Defense sentencing argument.
Per atty, 10 days jail credit
Defendant speaks on own behalf
BTC:  1 yr probation
6 mos RCJ, stayed
CFTS
30 hrs CSW
absolute sobriety, no alcohol, controlled substances, AODA, RUAs
continue program currently involved with.
$1000 + cc
DNA and surcharge
Re confiscation of money - Court will not confiscate the cash.  It is to be returned to defendant.  
FAW
voting prohibited
to suppress fruits of unconstitutional search, with Affidavit attached, filed by Atty Lettenberger.
Motion hearing on April 7, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Darrell J Bostwick in court with attorney Francis R. Lettenberger.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Def- Requesting a motion date.
BTC: Adj  Motion hearing scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the co-defendant, ANJ.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 01-27-2016: No contact condition removed.**

Defendant Darrell J Bostwick in court with attorney Francis R. Lettenberger.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Defense requests bond mod.
State takes no position.
BTC: Modification granted.  Status conference scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
